answerText: Eva Luna [accept either name][10] Eva Luna was written by this Chilean novelist, the author of The House of the Spirits.
heading: ACF Regionals |2013 | Penn A + Chicago B | 4 | Literature | World | College
subject: Literature
question: Question: This character describes how one could bed Hermelinda for two hours by tossing a coin into her vagina, thereby winning a game of "Toad's Mouth." For 10 points each: [10] Name this Scheherazade-like title character of a namesake novel who narrates many fanciful tales to her lover Rolf Carle as they lie in bed together. She is the daughter of Consuelo and a snakebitten gardener.
